column4: since kaudiocreator can not be installed due to it's dependencies (kdemultimedia-kio-plugin 3.5) I am looking for a recommendation on another ripping software.
what does it do?
konqueror can rip cds
Do you recommend it?
if you cant install via cd, yes
if you can install via cd i'd use that, its less complex to burn a cd and boot from it than put all the various gumf on a usb stick to boot from it
any gnome ripping package you would recommend?
for ripping what?
CDs
grip is one option
I used it. Anything better tnan that?
there is no better or "best" just wat you like
try a tonne of apps then choose one you like
OK, thanks.
there is no single answer, you need to reboot and count the options down, then set it to that
you could have 20 kernels installed and the number will be greater than if you had 1 or 2
there is no ONE answer, we can only tell you HOW you can get it yourself
yes you count those, count them all
Can I control the amount of Kernels saved for backup?
you can remove unused kernels to reduce entrys
can the update_manager get configured to hold just 2?
you can tell grub to only hold 2 but update manager will not, you must manually remove
